caseProcess.description: Riverton, Hamilton, Procuratorate received a tip regarding suspicious activities involving counterfeit currency. Investigation was initiated.
After sufficient evidence was collected, detention measures were taken against the suspect H. Walker.
H. Walker was criminally detained under suspicion of counterfeiting currency.
Formal arrest measures were implemented against H. Walker.

details.behavior: H. Walker was found to be in possession of manufacturing equipment and counterfeit bills amounting to $10,000 in a warehouse at 123 Mason Street, Hamilton.
details.evidence: Confiscated equipment, counterfeit currency seized, security footage from the warehouse.

details.behavior: Walker distributed counterfeit $100 bills to local retailers resulting in reported losses of approximately $5,000.
details.evidence: Testimonies from five local businesses, transaction receipts showing counterfeit involvement, forensic analysis of the counterfeit bills matched to Walker's equipment.

details.behavior: Walker attempted to launder counterfeit currency by purchasing high-value electronics from online marketplaces.
details.evidence: Digital transaction records, intercepted parcels containing counterfeit bills, statements from sellers who received counterfeit money.

details.behavior: Walker was found to be producing counterfeit currency equivalent to over $50,000, prepared for distribution within Hamilton.
details.evidence: A raid on Walker's residence and storage unit uncovered raw materials and partially completed notes totaling over $50,000 in counterfeit currency.

judgmentResult.sentence: 8 years imprisonment and a fine of $20,000.
judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: Given the substantial amount of counterfeit currency produced and distributed, the court applied a strict sentence within the statutory limits.
